content: Hello Mister Schmidt, my name is Yi-Nuo Wang from China. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment in Duisburg. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Yi-Nuo Wang from China

content: Hello Yi-Nuo, it's good to meet you. I'm sure you'll find my apartment very comfortable and convenient. What price were you thinking of offering for the rental?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, I appreciate the opportunity to discuss the rental price for your apartment. I'm looking for a fair and reasonable rate that reflects the value of the space and its central location. Could you please provide me with your initial asking price?
name: Yi-Nuo Wang from China

content: Of course, Yi-Nuo. I believe my apartment offers great value, and I'm looking for a tenant who appreciates its quality. My initial asking price is €800 per month. What do you think about this amount?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Thank you for sharing the initial asking price, Mister Schmidt. I understand that you believe the apartment provides good value. I'm here to negotiate the best price for both parties, so let's discuss the €800 per month offer. Is there any flexibility in this price?
name: Yi-Nuo Wang from China

content: While €800 is a very fair price for an apartment of this quality and location, I'm willing to consider lower offers if they are reasonable. What is your counter-proposal?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, I understand that you are open to considering lower offers. As a student, I'm looking for a price that fits within my budget while also reflecting the apartment's value. I would like to propose €750 per month. Does this counter-offer interest you?
name: Yi-Nuo Wang from China

content: Your offer of €750 is lower than I had in mind, but I'm willing to negotiate. If you're willing to pay a deposit of one month's rent, I could possibly accept your offer. What do you think of this proposal?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, I appreciate your willingness to consider my counter-offer. A deposit would certainly be a commitment on my part. However, I'm not sure if I'm comfortable with that at this moment. Could we discuss other terms that might make the €750 per month more acceptable to you without the need for a deposit?
name: Yi-Nuo Wang from China

content: Certainly, Yi-Nuo. Let's see if we can find a solution that works for both of us. Would you be willing to sign a longer lease term, perhaps two years, to make up for the lower monthly rent? This would provide me with some stability and might make your offer more attractive to me.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, a longer lease term could be an interesting proposition. I'm currently planning to stay in Duisburg for an extended period, so a two-year lease could work. Would you be willing to lower the rent to €750 per month if I agree to a two-year lease?
name: Yi-Nuo Wang from China

content: That's an interesting idea, Yi-Nuo. A two-year lease would give me the security of knowing the apartment is occupied for a longer period. If you're willing to commit to a two-year lease at €750 per month, I think we could have a deal. What do you say?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany
